Issues.Title: HitTest is buggy / not accurate when the UserControl's RenderTransform set to a large scale(ScaleX = ScaleY = 500)
Issues.Body:
### Description

.NET 6 or higher / WPF

I have set UserControl's RenderTransform to a ScaleTransform(ScaleX = ScaleY = 500), and set the UserControl's Template to be a Line shape. However, when running the application, I noticed that the mouse events of UserControl are triggered when the mouse click or move in the blank area near the line.
When I set the scale to a smaller value,like ScaleX = ScaleY = 1, I don't encounter this issue.

I find an similar problem here(https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/vstudio/en-US/8708e340-f734-4cf4-b91d-28b49fee2b72/hittest-is-buggy-not-accurate-for-transformed-scaled-etc-visuals?forum=wpf), but it seems that it has not been fixed yet.

Click in the blank area near the line：
![1](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/54102844/f2d5a652-9d73-4871-a22b-83ed311752ab)


### Reproduction Steps


My demo code in github: https://github.com/yao-xiaofei/ShapeTest

Here is my code:

```    
    <Grid>
        <UserControl PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown="UserControl_PreviewMouseLeftButtonDown">
            <UserControl.RenderTransform>
                <TransformGroup>
                    <ScaleTransform ScaleX="500" ScaleY="500" />
                </TransformGroup>
            </UserControl.RenderTransform>
            <UserControl.Template>
                <ControlTemplate>
                    <Line
                        Stroke="Lime"
                        StrokeThickness="0.01"
                        UseLayoutRounding="True"
                        X1="0.4"
                        X2="0.8"
                        Y1="0.3"
                        Y2="0.3" />
                    <ControlTemplate.Triggers>
                        <Trigger Property="IsMouseOver" Value="True">
                            <Setter Property="Cursor" Value="Cross" />
                        </Trigger>
                    </ControlTemplate.Triggers>
                </ControlTemplate>
            </UserControl.Template>
        </UserControl>
    </Grid>
```

### Expected behavior

My expectation is that when I set a larger scale value(ScaleX = ScaleY = 500 or larger), the UserControl should only respond to mouse events when clicking on the area of the line, and avoid triggering mouse events in the blank area.

![2](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/54102844/72f05918-42ad-4557-b721-d154fd1701f1)


### Actual behavior

The mouse events of UserControl are triggered when the mouse click or move in the blank area near the line.

Click in the blank area near the line：
![1](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/54102844/f2d5a652-9d73-4871-a22b-83ed311752ab)

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

_No response_

### Configuration

_No response_

### Other information

_No response_

Issues.Title: .NET 7 WPF app doesn't run on specific Windows 11 desktops
Issues.Body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Describe the bug

I have a WPF app that targets .NET 7.  It runs successfully on three, separate Windows computers.  On two, identical, Windows 11 computers, purchased this year, the application does not even open.  No window opens and the app does not show in Task Manager.  On the two computers in question, dotnet --list-runtimes reports:

Microsoft.NETCore.App 7.0.8 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 7.0.8 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]


### Expected Behavior

Issues.Title: About UpdateLayout method detect dead loop, why is there a magic number 153?
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/64b105766c64b379a4edd544e1a95c07af8d6e34/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationCore/System/Windows/LayoutManager.cs#L231C21-L231C36
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/25047407/ad64b76c-00d7-4e2a-abde-6bdcd09ddc11)

It‘s a magic number. Seems if the MeasureQueue or ArrangeQueue's length exceeds a number around it, the UpdateLayout method will call itself in Background. So is there any reason and why is it must be 153?

Is there a possibility if there are too many controls rending at same time, it will be regarded as a dead loop? And then it will call UpdateLayout again in background. Seems it will be endless. 

Anyone knows about it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "About UpdateLayout method detect dead loop, why is there a magic number 153?" (#7978)

### !! NO MERGE !!

#### Main PR <!-- Link to PR if any that fixed this in the main branch. -->
#138 

## Description
This PR is to test the integration of tests written in #138 with the build flow of WPF.  The aim here is to understand the changes required to run the tests on the pipeline. Once, we verify that tests run are running on pipeline, this PR will be closed.


<!-- Give a brief summary of the issue and how the pull request is fixing it. -->

Provides the team with relevant information to setup test infra for running unit tests on pipeline.
